Hello Markus,

Yeah it looks like it's not made for that. I suppose what you could do
is make DefaultServerCache implement ApplicationContextAware and grab
the job directory that way (see
ConfigPathConfigurer.setApplicationContext() for an example), then
pass the path to CrawlServer in DefaultServerCache.getServerFor(), and
finally pass it on to Robotstxt in CrawlServer.updateRobots(). But
yeah that's really messy.

What are you trying to accomplish?

Noah

On Fri, Apr 4, 2014 at 5:50 AM, Markus.Mirsberger
<markus.mirsberger@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I have to add some custom features to the
> org.archive.modules.net.RobotsTxt class.
> I need to access a custom file which is placed inside the JobDirectory.
> I tried a few hours to figure it out but I can't find out how to get the
> current JobDirectory path inside this class. :(
>
> Is there a way to get this path somehow from there?
>
>
> Thanks,
> Markus
>
